some.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a number of people or things, or an amount of something, when the exact number or amount is not stated
some.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I need some apples for this recipe.
My mother has inherited some land.
They’re looking for someone with some experience.
The doctor gave her some medicine for her cough.
some.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a number of people or things or an amount of something, but not all
some.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Some people believe in life after death.
She’s been so depressed that some days she can’t get out of bed.
some.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a fairly large number of people or things or a fairly large amount of something
some.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: It was some time before they managed to turn the alarm off.
The donation went some way toward paying for the damage.
some.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: used to mean a person or thing, when you do not know or say exactly which
some.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: There must be some reason for her behaviour.
Can you give me some idea of the cost?
We can hopefully reach some kind of agreement.
some.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: used when you are talking about a person or thing that you do not know, remember, or understand, or when you think it does not matter
some.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Some guy called for you while you were gone.
Just give him some excuse or other.
some.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: used to say that something was very good or very impressive
some.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: That was some party last night!
some.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: a number of people or things or an amount of something, but not a large number or amount
There were some children playing in the street.
‘Have we got any biscuits?’ ‘Yes, I’ve just bought some.’
a small number of people, things etc. A few is used when there is a smaller number than some
‘Are there any chocolates left?’ ‘Only a few.’
I’m going out with a few of my friends.
two or a very small number
Can I ask you a couple of questions?
I’ll just have a couple of drinks.
He just wants a little sugar.
a fairly large amount – use this to talk about people’s feelings, abilities etc
It’s a job that requires a certain amount of skill.
some.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a number of people or things or an amount of something, when the exact number or amount is not stated
some.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I’ve just made a pot of coffee. Would you like some?
‘Do you know where the screws are?’ ‘There are some in the garage.’
some.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a number of people or things or an amount of something, but not all
some.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Many local businesses are having difficulties, and some have even gone bankrupt.
Some say it was an accident, but I don’t believe it.
Many of the exhibits were damaged in the fire, and some were totally destroyed.
Some of his jokes were very rude.
Can I have some of your cake?
some.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: ‘Are you feeling better today?’ ‘Some, I guess.’
some.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: tending to behave in a particular way, or having a particular quality
some.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: a bothersome back injury  (=that bothers you)
some.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: a group of a particular number, for example in a game
some.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: a golf foursome  (=four people playing golf together)
